dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: OH MY GOSH! You will not believe this article I just read. These numbers are, like, absolutely insane!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: O H M Y G O S H! You will not believe this article I just read. These numbers are, like, absolutely insane!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty wild out there, isn't it? Hollywood deals can get pretty complex, um, with all the big names involved.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty wild out there, isn't it? Hollywood deals can get pretty complex, um, with all the big names involved.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Complex? Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson made almost NINETY MILLION DOLLARS in one year! What even is that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Complex? Dwayne The Rock Johnson made almost N I N E T Y M I L L I O N D O L L A R S in one year! What even is that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dwayne Johnson, also known as the Rock, tops the Forbes list of the worlds ten highest-paid actors, collecting $89.4 million between June 1, 2018, and June 1, 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Well, see, for someone like him, it's about, um, being a brand. He calls it "audience first."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, see, for someone like him, it's about, um, being a brand. He calls it audience first.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has to be audience first. What does the audience want, and what is the best scenario that we can create that will send them home happy? Johnson told Forbes in 2018.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Audience first? So he's just... selling movies, for that much money?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Audience first? So he's just... selling movies, for that much money?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Kind of. He's got, like, a formula. Upfront salary, sure, but also a big chunk of, uh, the movie's overall profits. Up to fifteen percent, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kind of. He's got, like, a formula. Upfront salary, sure, but also a big chunk of, uh, the movie's overall profits. Up to fifteen percent, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hell collect an upfront salary of up to $23.5 millionhis highest quote yetfor the forthcoming Jumanji: The Next Level. He also commands up to 15% of the pool from high-grossing franchise movies, including Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, which had a worldwide box office of $962.1 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Fifteen percent? Of, like, ALL the money? That's what the old "twenty-twenty deal" was about, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fifteen percent? Of, like, A L L the money? That's what the old twenty-twenty deal was about, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the lucrative twenty-twenty deal ($20 million upfront and 20% of gross profit) doled out to the likes of Harrison Ford and Tom Cruise may be more or less gone, Hollywood still has its big-money brands

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. That's the legendary one for people like, um, Harrison Ford back in the day. It's super rare now, but The Rock's deal gets pretty close.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. That's the legendary one for people like, um, Harrison Ford back in the day. It's super rare now, but The Rock's deal gets pretty close.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the lucrative twenty-twenty deal ($20 million upfront and 20% of gross profit) doled out to the likes of Harrison Ford and Tom Cruise may be more or less gone... Johnson has landed a pay formula as close to the famed twenty-twenty deal of yore as any star can get these days.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So like, Robert Downey Jr. then, for Iron Man? He must have made a fortune, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So like, Robert Downey Jr. then, for Iron Man? He must have made a fortune, too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. He got twenty million upfront plus eight percent of the, uh, pool for Endgame. That was like 55 million just for that movie!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. He got twenty million upfront plus eight percent of the, uh, pool for Endgame. That was like fifty five million just for that movie!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Robert Downey Jr. gets $20 million upfront and nearly 8% of the pool for his role as Iron Man, and that amounted to about $55 million for his work in Avengers: Endgame, which grossed $2.796 billion at the box office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: That's just one movie! And Chris Hemsworth, too? They even mentioned him considering not doing Endgame?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's just one movie! And Chris Hemsworth, too? They even mentioned him considering not doing Endgame?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, apparently creative differences, but the directors, uh, talked him back into it. Good thing for him, obviously.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, apparently creative differences, but the directors, uh, talked him back into it. Good thing for him, obviously.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: And then Bradley Cooper, he like, didn't take an upfront salary for A Star Is Born? What?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Bradley Cooper, he like, didn't take an upfront salary for A Star Is Born? What?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The movie was a passion project for Cooper, and he forfeited any upfront salary to go into the film and Gagas salary.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. He bet on himself, you know? Directed it, starred in it. Went all in on that, um, passion project.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. He bet on himself, you know? Directed it, starred in it. Went all in on that, um, passion project.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The movie was a passion project for Cooper, and he forfeited any upfront salary to go into the film and Gagas salary.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: And that paid off, like, big time?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that paid off, like, big time?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, hugely. The movie made a fortune, and he ended up with about forty million from it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, hugely. The movie made a fortune, and he ended up with about forty million from it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It paid offthe movie, which had a production budget of only $36 million, grossed $435 million worldwide, leaving Cooper with an estimated $40 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Just... wow. I mean, I knew they made money, but this is, uh, mind-blowing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Just... wow. I mean, I knew they made money, but this is, uh, mind-blowing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: It really is, once you, like, dig into the numbers and how these huge deals actually work.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is, once you, like, dig into the numbers and how these huge deals actually work.
